keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: For years, Turkey served as a rear base, transit hub and shopping bazaar for the Islamic State, but now, officials say Tuesday’s attack bore ISIS hallmarks.

headline.print_headline: Ending Free Rein for ISIS, Turkey Learns Its Wrath
headline.main: Turkey, a Conduit for Fighters Joining ISIS, Begins to Feel Its Wrath

snippet: For years, Turkey served as a rear base, transit hub and shopping bazaar for the Islamic State, but now, officials say Tuesday’s attack bore ISIS hallmarks.
abstract: Analysts say attacks like suicide bombings at Istanbul's main airport are price Turkey is paying for stepping up its efforts to fight Islamic State after years of serving as kind of transit hub and shopping bazaar for group; experts say group's reluctance to claim responsibility for attacks like one on airport points to its desire to both punish Turkey and avoid all-out confrontation with government there.
